intro: Austrostipa wakoolica, commonly known as the Wakool grass, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its tufted growth habit and slender, wiry stems. The plant produces small, spikelet-based inflorescences that are typically green to pale brown in color. Austrostipa wakoolica is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for grazing animals in its native habitat.
